<div class="esv"><h2>Exodus 6</h2>
<div class="esv-text"><h3 id="p02006001.01-1">God Promises Deliverance</h3>
<p id="p02006001.04-1"><span class="chapter-num" id="v02006001-1">6:1&nbsp;</span>But the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said to Moses, &#8220;Now you shall see what I will do to Pharaoh; for with a strong hand he will send them out, and with a strong hand he will drive them out of his land.&#8221;</p>
 <p class="chapter-first" id="p02006002.01-1"><span class="verse-num" id="v02006002-1">2&nbsp;</span>God spoke to Moses and said to him, &#8220;I am the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>. <span class="verse-num" id="v02006003-1">3&nbsp;</span>I appeared to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, as God Almighty,<span class="footnote">&nbsp;<a href="#f1" id="b1" title="Hebrew 'El Shaddai'">[1]</a></span> but by my name the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> I did not make myself known to them. <span class="verse-num" id="v02006004-1">4&nbsp;</span>I also established my covenant with them to give them the land of Canaan, the land in which they lived as sojourners. <span class="verse-num" id="v02006005-1">5&nbsp;</span>Moreover, I have heard the groaning of the people of Israel whom the Egyptians hold as slaves, and I have remembered my covenant. <span class="verse-num" id="v02006006-1">6&nbsp;</span>Say therefore to the people of Israel, &#8216;I am the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and I will bring you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians, and I will deliver you from slavery to them, and I will redeem you with an outstretched arm and with great acts of judgment. <span class="verse-num" id="v02006007-1">7&nbsp;</span>I will take you to be my people, and I will be your God, and you shall know that I am the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God, who has brought you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians. <span class="verse-num" id="v02006008-1">8&nbsp;</span>I will bring you into the land that I swore to give to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob. I will give it to you for a possession. I am the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.&#8217;&#8221; <span class="verse-num" id="v02006009-1">9&nbsp;</span>Moses spoke thus to the people of Israel, but they did not listen to Moses, because of their broken spirit and harsh slavery.</p>
 <p id="p02006010.01-1"><span class="verse-num" id="v02006010-1">10&nbsp;</span>So the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said to Moses, <span class="verse-num" id="v02006011-1">11&nbsp;</span>&#8220;Go in, tell Pharaoh king of Egypt to let the people of Israel go out of his land.&#8221; <span class="verse-num" id="v02006012-1">12&nbsp;</span>But Moses said to the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, &#8220;Behold, the people of Israel have not listened to me. How then shall Pharaoh listen to me, for I am of uncircumcised lips?&#8221; <span class="verse-num" id="v02006013-1">13&nbsp;</span>But the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spoke to Moses and Aaron and gave them a charge about the people of Israel and about Pharaoh king of Egypt: to bring the people of Israel out of the land of Egypt.</p>
 <h3 id="p02006014.01-1">The Genealogy of Moses and Aaron</h3>
<p id="p02006014.07-1"><span class="verse-num" id="v02006014-1">14&nbsp;</span>These are the heads of their fathers' houses: the sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel: Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi; these are the clans of Reuben. <span class="verse-num" id="v02006015-1">15&nbsp;</span>The sons of Simeon: Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Shaul, the son of a Canaanite woman; these are the clans of Simeon. <span class="verse-num" id="v02006016-1">16&nbsp;</span>These are the names of the sons of Levi according to their generations: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari, the years of the life of Levi being 137 years. <span class="verse-num" id="v02006017-1">17&nbsp;</span>The sons of Gershon: Libni and Shimei, by their clans. <span class="verse-num" id="v02006018-1">18&nbsp;</span>The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, the years of the life of Kohath being 133 years. <span class="verse-num" id="v02006019-1">19&nbsp;</span>The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the clans of the Levites according to their generations. <span class="verse-num" id="v02006020-1">20&nbsp;</span>Amram took as his wife Jochebed his father's sister, and she bore him Aaron and Moses, the years of the life of Amram being 137 years. <span class="verse-num" id="v02006021-1">21&nbsp;</span>The sons of Izhar: Korah, Nepheg, and Zichri. <span class="verse-num" id="v02006022-1">22&nbsp;</span>The sons of Uzziel: Mishael, Elzaphan, and Sithri. <span class="verse-num" id="v02006023-1">23&nbsp;</span>Aaron took as his wife Elisheba, the daughter of Amminadab and the sister of Nahshon, and she bore him Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar. <span class="verse-num" id="v02006024-1">24&nbsp;</span>The sons of Korah: Assir, Elkanah, and Abiasaph; these are the clans of the Korahites. <span class="verse-num" id="v02006025-1">25&nbsp;</span>Eleazar, Aaron's son, took as his wife one of the daughters of Putiel, and she bore him Phinehas. These are the heads of the fathers' houses of the Levites by their clans.</p>
 <p id="p02006026.01-1"><span class="verse-num" id="v02006026-1">26&nbsp;</span>These are the Aaron and Moses to whom the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said: &#8220;Bring out the people of Israel from the land of Egypt by their hosts.&#8221; <span class="verse-num" id="v02006027-1">27&nbsp;</span>It was they who spoke to Pharaoh king of Egypt about bringing out the people of Israel from Egypt, this Moses and this Aaron.</p>
 <p id="p02006028.01-1"><span class="verse-num" id="v02006028-1">28&nbsp;</span>On the day when the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spoke to Moses in the land of Egypt, <span class="verse-num" id="v02006029-1">29&nbsp;</span>the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said to Moses, &#8220;I am the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; tell Pharaoh king of Egypt all that I say to you.&#8221; <span class="verse-num" id="v02006030-1">30&nbsp;</span>But Moses said to the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, &#8220;Behold, I am of uncircumcised lips. How will Pharaoh listen to me?&#8221;</p>
